model_solution:
Step 1: Write out the place values for a base 7 number.
Since $634_7$ has three digits, the place values are $7^2$, $7^1$, and $7^0$.
Step 2: Multiply each digit of the base 7 number by its corresponding place value.
\[\begin{aligned} 634_7 & =6\left(7^2\right)+3\left(7^1\right)+4\left(7^0\right)\\ & =6\left(49\right)+3\left(7\right)+4\left(1\right)\\ & =294+21+4 \end{aligned}\]
Step 3: Evaluate the expression.
$=294+21+4=319$
Step 4: The value $634_7$ in base 10 is $319$.
Step 5: = 319
Step 6: $= 319$ Final Answer

full_steps:
Step 1: Write out the place values for a base 7 number.
Since $634_7$ has three digits, the place values are $7^2$, $7^1$, and $7^0$.

Step 2: Multiply each digit of the base 7 number by its corresponding place value.
\[\begin{aligned} 634_7 & =6\left(7^2\right)+3\left(7^1\right)+4\left(7^0\right)\\ & =6\left(49\right)+3\left(7\right)+4\left(1\right)\\ & =294+21+4 \end{aligned}\]
Step 4: The value $634_7$ in base 10 is $319$.
